Documentation
Margo CSS

Layout

Containers

Containers dictate the width of the content. A div with a class of container-full will extend the full width of the page and a div with a class of container-narrow will have a max-width of 960px and will be centered with margin: auto. You can nest a container-narrow inside of a container-full.

Container-narrow

<div class="container-narrow">
       
       ....

    </div>

<div class="container-narrow">

Grid

Grids must have an outer-div with a class of grid-container (<div class="grid-container">)

The column widths are specified as divs inside the grid-container, and you can target column sizes for three (3) screen-widths:

    sm < 750px,
    md > 750px
    lg > 1000px.

<div class="grid-container">
   <div class="sm-[n]-x-12 md-[n]-x-12 lg-[n]-x-12">
   ....
   </div>
</div>

A div with a class of md-6-x-12 will take up 50% (6 by 12 columns) of the container on medium sized screens (750px) and up. A div with a class of lg-3-x-12 will take up 25% (3 by 12 columns) of large sized screens (1000px +).

Example

<div class="grid-container">
   <div class="see below">...</div>
</div>
sm-12-x-12
md-6-x-12
lg-4-x-12
sm-12-x-12
md-6-x-12
lg-4-x-12
sm-12-x-12
md-6-x-12
lg-4-x-12
sm-6-x-12
md-4-x-12
lg-3-x-12
sm-6-x-12
md-4-x-12
lg-3-x-12
sm-8-x-12
md-6-x-12
lg-3-x-12
sm-4-x-12
md-6-x-12
lg-3-x-12
sm-4-x-12
md-3-x-12
lg-2-x-12
sm-4-x-12
md-3-x-12
lg-2-x-12

General Formatting

Typography

Heading Tags

Heading : <h1>

Heading : <h2>

Heading : <h3>

Heading : <h4>

Heading : <h5>
Heading : <h6>

Text Formats

The text right here is inside of a <p> tag. All text sizes and line heights are calculated based on ems. The standard paragraph text is sized at 1em. And the default line-height is set to 1.25em on mobile to accomodate the lesser screen height and 1.625em on tablet/desktop for ideal legibility.

link example
( in<a> tag )
code syntax
( in<code> tag )
highlighted text
( in <mark> tag )
line-through text
( in <del> )
small text
(in <small> tag )

Buttons

Default

<button class="btn">...</button>

<a class="btn">...</button>

<input class="btn" type="button" ... >

<input class="btn" type="submit" ...>
"btn sm"
"btn md"
"btn lg"

Primary

<button class="btn">...</button>

<a class="btn primary">...</button>

<input class="btn primary" type="button" ... >

<input class="btn primary" type="submit" ...>
"btn primary sm"
"btn primary md"
"btn primary lg"

Tables + Forms

Tables

Short Table

<table>

Name Age Bed Time Favorite Animal
Zoey 4 9:30 Giraffe
Haley 2 8:00 Tiger
Rylan 1 7:30 TBD

 

Full Width Table + Striped

<div class="table-full-width">
   <table>...</table>
</div>
Rank Team W-L Record Pts For
1 food fight 8-4 1,137.88
2 Foxy Tacos 7-5 1,184.96
3 DorkTron 7-5 912.22
4 It's Just A Name 6-6 1,158.42

Forms

Forms need to be inside a form tag with a class of form-group. To achieve column formatting, it is strongly advised that you use also apply the grid-container class to the form tag.

label + input pairs should be encapsulated inside a class of form-field
( plus whatever column styles e.g col-sm-12 col-md-6 ) to achieve block styling.

<form class="form-group  grid-container">
   <div class="form-field  sm-[n]-x-12 md-[n]-x-12">
      <label>...</label>
      <input type="text"/>
   </div>
</div>

Quick Form

<form class="form-group">


Long Form

<form class="form-group grid-container">

<form class="form-group grid-container">
   
   <div class="form-field sm-12-x-12 md-4-x-12">
       <label for="firstField">First </label>
       <input type="text"/ >
   </div>

   <div class="form-field sm-12-x-12 md-4-x-12">
       <label for="middleField">Middle </label>
       <input type="text"/ >
   </div>

   <div class="form-field sm-12-x-12 md-4-x-12">
       <label for="lastField">Last </label>
       <input type="text"/ >
   </div>

   <div class="form-field sm-12-x-12 md-6-x-12">
       <label for="emailField">Email </label>
       <input type="email"/ >
   </div>

   <div class="form-field sm-12-x-12 md-6-x-12">
       <label for="nameField">State </label>
       <select/ >
         <option value="CA">California </option>
         <option value="NY">New York </option>
         <option value="TX">Texas </option>
     </select>
   </div>

   <div class="sm-12-x-12 md-12-x-12 form-field">
      <label for="nameField">Description </label>
      <textarea rows="6"> </textarea>
   </div>
  
   <div class="sm-6-x-12 md-6-x-12 form-field">
       <input type="submit" class="btn md primary"/ >
   </div>
  
 </form>

Components

Hero-Header

Commonly seen on landing pages.

Example

You might land here one day

And I will be waiting with a bouquet of flowers

<header class="hero">
      <!-- puts max-width on hero's inner text -->
       <div class="container-narrow">
        
          <h1 class="title">...</h1>
        
          <h3 class="subtitle">...</h3>
          ...
       
       </div>
    </header>

Navigation

Navigation is responsive and written entirely in CSS. However, it is opinionated about the ordering of the html-elemnts. See the comment in the example code below. Margo's navbar is encapsulated within <nav class="navbar">.

Example

About Contact Our Mission Blog Register Log In 
<nav class="nav-bar">
        <!--
          You must include both <input type="checkbox" class="hamburger-toggler>
          and <div class="hamburger-toggler"> in the order shown below 
          for the responsive menu to work
        -->
        <input type="checkbox" class="hamburger-toggler"/>

        <div class="hamburger-menu">
          <hr class="mid-line" /> 
        </div>

        <div class="nav-list">
          <a href="..."> Link 1 </a>
          <a href="..."> Link 2 </a>
        </div>

    </nav>

Callout Segment

Use a callout segment for any kind of content that you want to emphasize. To use this component, you use the HTML5 <section> tag with a class of segment.

Example

Places that start with M

  • Minneapolis
  • Marfa
  • Madison

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. Provident earum modi corrupti exp edita, accusantium numquam nesciunt non eum ipsa iste voluptate saepe, sit quibusdam odio suscipit inventore velit quos aperiam ducimus dicta perspiciatis.

<section class="segment">
    
       <h4>Cities that start with M</h4>
       
       <ul>
          <li>Minneapolis</li>   <li>Marfa</li>
          <li>Madison</li>
       </ul>

       <p>
          Lorem ipsum...
       </p>
    
    </section>

Sidebars

Example found here on the left.

The Margo Sidebar is a fixed panel on the the left side of the page and is created with
<aside class="sidebar">. It has a view-height of 100% and a default width of 250px. For narrower screens and on mobile devices, it collapses to the top of the page.

In order for the Sidebar to work properly in your layout, you must have <div class="container-full"> immediately after it. Because the sidebar is a major layout component, it should also be near the root of your <body> element.

<aside class="sidebar">
   ...
</aside>
<div class="container-full">
   <!--site content-->
</div>

Sidebar Code Example – Recommended Use

Note: The use of <hr class='nav-spacer'> is a helper class that gives padding for the fixed-navbar.

<aside class="sidebar">

  <div class="sidebar-content">
    <a href='#go-here'>Go Here On Page</a>
    <a href='#place2'>Another place to go</a>
  </div>
  
</aside>

<!--
  Element will have 250px of padding to 
  account for the spacing of fixed-width aside.sidebar 
-->
<div class="container-full">
    
   <div class="container-narrow">
    
      <!-- Site Content -->

   </div>

</div>

Thumbnails/Cards

Card thumbnails uses HTML5 <figure> tag with a class of tn-card and are 270px in width. 

<figure class="tn-card">

      <img class="card-image" alt="..." src="...">
      
      <figcaption>
        <!-- <h4> recommended for title -->
      </figcaption>

      <figcaption class="more-info">
        <!-- appends a box with a top border and muted, smaller text-->
      </figcaption>

    </figure>

Miscellaneous

Code Blocks

Encapsulated in <pre><code> ... </pre></code>. Be mindful of whitespace inside of <pre> tag. 

<pre>
      <code>
        <h2>This is code</h2>
        <p>And this is what might happen if you extend past the width of the <pre> container-- a scroll bar will appear. No word-wrap.</p>
      </code>
    </pre>
